page.title: 14The new Inn filling station
page.content: When the Hoddy family came to the New Inn on the 6th June 1946 there was one hand and one electric pump.Originally the filling station was a deport for 2 gallon cans, delivered by the firm of pratts in the days before large undergrund storage tanks. Petrol costs july 4th 1985 2.01p per gallon or 44.30p per litre.Oil is between 4.75&6.50 for 5 litre can. The Esso tanker delivers petrol weekly from West drayton London. Petrol sales from the 4 pumps are approximately 5000 gallons a week.The filling station at Padbury sales in crease when special events take place locally such as Motor racing at silverstone or country fair at stowe. The garage owners are free agents so as well as ESSO,Duckhams & Castrol products are sweets , crips & soft drinks are sold.
